Action.name: Action
Action.description: When you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.bd6278f18bbd6739]{Ask the Oracle} about a goal, situation, or event, roll for an Action and Theme. Together, these provide an interpretative verb/noun prompt.

Anomaly Effect.name: Anomaly Effect
Anomaly Effect.description: Meddling with alien artifacts or forbidden magic may put you at the mercy of chaos. Use this table to resolve the effects of ancient tech, rituals, or other strange forces. Results on this table may have devastating implications, so use it only in rare and dramatic moments.

results.19-21: Causes rapid biological growth or infestation
results.28-30: Corrupts or infects devices or computers
results.34-36: Decays or weakens surrounding terrain or structures
results.37-39: Drains energy from equipment or devices
results.52-54: Generates tendrils of energy that slither or grasp
results.61-63: Nullifies or destroys equipment or devices
results.64-66: Opens a path to another location
results.73-75: Reveals glimpses of the distant past
results.76-78: Reveals glimpses of the far future
results.79-81: Reverses time by a few moments or minutes
results.85-87: Summons or manifests an ancient being or intelligence

Area.name: Area
Area.description: Roll on this table to help envision the spaces you encounter in that segment of your exploration. Each zone may consist of one or more areas as appropriate to what you envision for the overall complexity of the derelict. If you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.3ff03b51f620ab26]{Undertake an Expedition}, an area can serve as a waypoint in your survey of the derelict.

results.86-100: New zone via Access

Background Assets.name: Background Assets
Background Assets.description: If you want some direction for your starting paths, roll or pick from the table below and take the two paths associated with your selected background.

Backstory Prompts.name: Backstory Prompts
Backstory Prompts.description: For some backstory inspiration, roll or pick from the table below. Then, take a moment to elaborate on the suggestion. Or just leave it a bit vague and mysterious for now; you can flesh it out in play.

results.1-7: You abandoned your kin after learning a troubling truth
results.8-13: You are guided by a vision or prophecy
results.14-20: You are haunted by past actions or failures
results.21-27: You are running from a criminal past
results.28-34: You are the sole survivor of an attack or calamity
results.35-40: You escaped an abusive or unjust situation
results.41-46: You have no memory of your former life
results.47-53: You rejected a duty or destiny
results.54-60: You were banished from your former home
results.68-74: You were on your own for as long as you can remember
results.75-81: You were sent away on a prolonged mission
results.82-87: You were taken or lured away by someone
results.88-94: Your ambitions outgrew your humble origins
results.95-100: Your wanderlust carried you far away

results.1-10: Флэшбэк раскрывает аспект вашего прошлого или природы
results.11-20: Флэшбэк раскрывает аспект другого персонажа, места или фракции
results.21-30: Влиятельный персонаж или фракция вводятся или получают новую деталь
results.31-40: Оказывается, что несвязанные ситуации оказываются связанными
results.41-50: Внешние факторы создают новую опасность, срочность или важность для миссии
results.51-60: Важный персонаж оказывается в опасности или терпит неудачу
results.61-70: Ключевое место становится небезопасным или погружается в конфликт
results.81-90: Опасность впереди или скрывается вне поля зрения
results.91-100: Непредвиденная помощь на пути или в пределах досягаемости

Biomes.name: Biomes
Biomes.description: To learn the major terrain and environment types found on a Vital World, first roll on the diversity table. Then, roll the indicated number of times on the biomes table. If you get a duplicate result, roll again, or envision that landscape as more dominant, unusual, or dramatic.

Callsign.name: Callsign
Callsign.description: Spacers are often known only by their callsigns, with their “dirtside names” reserved for family and close friends.

Class.name: Class
Class.description: This oracle provides a simple method of generating a planetary class. If this is enough information, stop there and envision the world as appropriate to its type. For a bit more detail, make a roll on the Descriptor oracle and envision how that aspect defines the nature of the planet or a specific planetside location.

results.1-15: Desert World
results.16-30: Furnace World
results.31-35: Grave World
results.36-50: Ice World
results.51-65: Jovian World
results.66-70: Jungle World
results.71-75: Ocean World
results.76-90: Rocky World
results.91-92: Shattered World
results.93-98: Tainted World
results.99-100: Vital World

Combat Action.name: Combat Action
Combat Action.description: Use this oracle to help inspire an action for a foe in a fight. When you’re not sure what an enemy does next, particularly when they have you in a bad spot, roll on this table and interpret the result as appropriate to the nature of the enemy and your objective.

results.1-3: Block a path or cut off an objective
results.25-27: Destroy something or render it useless
results.37-39: Leverage the advantage of a weapon or ability
results.46-48: Make a cautious or probing attack
results.49-51: Make a ferocious or powerful attack
results.52-54: Make a precise or careful attack
results.64-66: Nullify a system, device, or weapon
results.82-84: Shift the fight to a new area
results.91-93: Use an unexpected weapon or ability

results.25-27: Horde of insatiable hunger or fury
results.46-50: Messenger or signal with a dire warning
results.51-53: Passage to a grim alternate reality
results.59-63: Powerful distortions of time or space
results.93-96: Vault of dread technology or power
results.97-100: Worshipers of great and malevolent powers

Descriptor.name: Descriptor
Descriptor.description: When you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.bd6278f18bbd6739]{Ask the Oracle} to help define the nature of a location, discovery, or encounter, roll for a Descriptor and a Focus for an adjective/noun prompt.

Diversity.name: Diversity
Diversity.description: To learn the major terrain and environment types found on a Vital World, first roll on the diversity table. Then, roll the indicated number of times on the biomes table. If you get a duplicate result, roll again, or envision that landscape as more dominant, unusual, or dramatic.

Encountered Behavior.name: Encountered Behavior
Encountered Behavior.description: Roll once on the Encountered Behavior table to define this creature’s motivation and frame how the encounter begins.

results.11-20: Вы умираете. В течение часа или двух вы должны @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.2051538f0c9d5d27]{Вылечиться} и поднять свое здоровье выше 0, или @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.0cfcd6fbaf6135d0]{Встретить Смерть}.
results.21-35: Вы без сознания и не можете действовать. Если вас оставить одного, вы придете в себя через час или два. Если вы уязвимы для продолжающегося вреда, @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.0cfcd6fbaf6135d0]{Встретить Смерть}.
results.36-50: Вы ошеломлены и боретесь за то, чтобы оставаться в сознании. Если вы займетесь любой энергичной деятельностью до того, как отдохнете несколько минут, бросьте на этой таблице снова (до выполнения другого хода).

results.26-50: Вы поддаетесь страху или принуждению и действуете против своих лучших намерений.

Environment.name: Environment
Environment.description: Choose the closest match for your location. Or roll to identify the primary habitat of a creature.

Family Name.name: Family Name
Family Name.description: Given and family names can be used independently as standalone names. In many cases you can reverse the order.

Feature.name: Feature
Feature.description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

results.1-8: Adherents performing worship or enacting rituals
results.33-40: Graves or remains of glorified disciples
results.65-72: Protected reliquary of an artifact or token
results.81-88: Subtle manifestations of mystical power or visions
results.89-96: Tokens or motifs representing the faith's domain
results.97-100: Descriptor + Focus

results.91-100: Starship Mission

Focus.name: Focus
Focus.description: When you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.bd6278f18bbd6739]{Ask the Oracle} to help define the nature of a location, discovery, or encounter, roll for a Descriptor and a Focus for an adjective/noun prompt.

Given Name.name: Given Name
Given Name.description: Given and family names can be used independently as standalone names. In many cases you can reverse the order.

results.81-90: Action + Theme

results.1-5: Aid a starship caught in a spacetime fracture
results.6-10: Broker peace between two feuding settlements
results.11-15: Chart a new passage between isolated settlements
results.16-20: Defend the people of a beleaguered settlement against raiders
results.21-25: Discover who sabotaged a settlement's air processors
results.26-30: Escort a tradeship carrying a prized cargo
results.31-35: Ferry a rescue team to a perilous disaster site
results.36-40: Infiltrate a fortified base to steal crucial data
results.41-45: Investigate terrifying manifestations at a remote settlement
results.46-50: Liberate prisoners at a cruel labor camp
results.51-55: Locate a downed spacer on an uninhabited planet
results.56-60: Protect a fugitive from a relentless bounty hunter
results.61-65: Recover a cherished pre-exodus artifact from an enemy
results.66-70: Rescue a starship crew held captive by mutineers
results.71-75: Retrieve a cache of stolen weapons from a pirate ship
results.81-85: Search for a missing expedition in the depths of a precursor vault
results.86-90: Shield a wondrous lifeform from those who seek to destroy it
results.91-95: Track and slay a marauding beast
results.96-100: Transport a displaced people to their new home

results.11-30: Isolated (Limited influence in a remote location)
results.31-50: Localized (Marginal influence in a single sector)
results.51-70: Established (Strong influence in a single sector)
results.71-85: Notable (Dispersed influence across a few sectors)

results.94-100: Descriptor + Focus

results.1-4: Clue to a lifeform's nature or vulnerabilities
results.5-8: Friendly interaction with a benign lifeform
results.9-12: Hunting or foraging opportunities are plentiful
results.13-16: Interesting or helpful aspect of benign creatures
results.17-20: Interesting or helpful aspect of local plant life
results.29-32: Advance warning of an environmental threat
results.33-36: Clear path through otherwise perilous terrain
results.37-40: Clue offers insight into a current quest or mystery
results.41-44: Clue to the history or nature of this place
results.45-48: Evidence that others have passed this way
results.49-52: Foe reveals themselves or tips their hand
results.53-56: Fortuitous change in the weather or atmosphere
results.61-64: Helpful resource is in ample supply
results.65-68: Impressive vista offers comfort or inspiration
results.73-76: Interesting site offers opportunities for exploration
results.77-80: Moment of fellowship or inner peace
results.81-84: Opening to distract, escape, or avoid foes
results.85-88: Opening to get the drop on a foe
results.89-92: Plea for help from a potential benefactor
results.93-96: Refuge offers a place to hide, plan, or recover
results.97-100: Vantage point reveals the lay of the land

results.11-15: Advance warning of an environmental threat
results.16-20: Clear path through otherwise perilous terrain
results.21-25: Clue offers insight into a current quest or mystery
results.26-30: Clue to the history or nature of this place
results.31-35: Evidence that others have passed this way
results.36-40: Foe reveals themselves or tips their hand
results.41-45: Fortuitous change in the weather or atmosphere
results.51-55: Helpful resource is in ample supply
results.56-60: Impressive vista offers comfort or inspiration
results.66-70: Interesting site offers opportunities for exploration
results.71-75: Moment of fellowship or inner peace
results.76-80: Opening to distract, escape, or avoid foes
results.81-85: Opening to get the drop on a foe
results.86-90: Plea for help from a potential benefactor
results.91-95: Refuge offers a place to hide, plan, or recover
results.96-100: Vantage point reveals the lay of the land

results.1-4: Advanced technology waiting to be harnessed or salvaged
results.9-10: Artificial consciousness evolved to a higher state
results.11-12: Clues to a crucial resource or uncharted domain
results.13-14: Envoy from another time or reality
results.25-26: Gateway to another time or alternate reality
results.27-28: Key to unlocking a language or method of communication
results.51-56: Monumental architecture or artistry of an ancient civilization
results.57-62: Mysterious device or artifact of potential value
results.63-66: New understanding of an enduring mystery
results.67-68: Pathway or means of travel to a distant location
results.69-70: Person or lifeform with phenomenal abilities
results.89-90: Visions or prophesies of the future

Name.name: Name
Name.description: Give a starship a name when it has an important role in your story. Scan this table and select a name which fits what you know of the ship’s appearance and role. Or generate a random result and let any contradictions contribute to the ship’s history or nature.

Name Template.name: Name Template
Name Template.description:
To generate a faction name, first roll or choose the name template. Then, follow the structure of the template to build the name from individual tables. If you’ve already set the faction type, picking from the tables (instead of rolling) will likely provide a more appropriate result. For example, “Silver Jackals” is a fitting name for a criminal organization. The “Empire of the Undying Suns” is a less apt name for that gang—unless their leader is prone to delusions of grandeur. In short, choosing a name will give you more control. Rolling might give you a result that doesn’t square with known aspects, but those contradictions may prove inspiring.

An alternative approach to generating a faction from scratch is to start with a random name. Then, consider what the name evokes and choose an appropriate faction type instead of rolling on those tables. For example, “Bloody Ravens” might suggest a mercenary guild, while the “Republic of the Radiant Servants” brings to mind a dominion built upon a religion, or one that idolizes a prophesied leader. If a result doesn’t inspire anything interesting, roll again or pick.

results.1-40: Legacy ⏵Affiliation
results.41-55: Legacy ⏵Identity
results.56-70: Identity *of the* ⏵Legacy ⏵Affiliation
results.71-100: Affiliation *of the* ⏵Legacy ⏵Identity

results.89-98: Descriptor + Focus
results.99-100: Precursor Vault (orbital)

Opportunity.name: Opportunity
Opportunity.description: Roll on this table when you want inspiration for a beneficial encounter or event within a derelict, such as when you roll a strong hit with a match as you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.3ff03b51f620ab26]{Undertake an Expedition}, or if you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.367804b98f30d5f4]{Explore a Waypoint} and find an opportunity.

results.68-70: Phasing in and out of reality
results.96-100: Descriptor + Focus

results.1-2: Надежный человек или сообщество действует против вас
results.3-4: Человек или сообщество, которые вам дороги, подвергаются опасности
results.15-18: Вы сталкиваетесь с последствиями предыдущего выбора
results.19-22: Неожиданное развитие событий усложняет ваше задание
results.23-26: Вы отделяетесь от чего-то или кого-то
results.27-32: Ваше действие вызывает сопутствующий ущерб или имеет непредвиденный эффект
results.39-44: Окружающая среда или местность вводит новую угрозу
results.51-56: Друг, компаньон или союзник в опасности (или вы, если вы один)
results.57-62: Ваше оборудование или транспортное средство выходит из строя
results.89-95: Вы застряли или поставлены в невыгодное положение

Peril.name: Peril
Peril.description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

results.1-9: Dreadful atmosphere of loss and destruction weighs upon you
results.10-18: Evidence of a horrible fate for others who passed this way
results.28-36: Hostile creature has staked out their territory
results.46-54: Lured into a trap or targeted by automated defenses
results.55-63: Source of the destruction persists or returns anew
results.91-98: Action + Theme

Prefix.name: Prefix
Prefix.description: To give a sector or region of space a random name, roll once for the first word and once for the second word. Or just roll once choose a suitable pairing from anywhere in that row.

Projects.name: Projects
Projects.description: Check the Settlement Projects table when it’s appropriate for your character to know or uncover these details. Projects are the main industry, function, or focus of a settlement. They do not necessarily represent every activity at the site—particularly at a large settlement—but are the most visible or noteworthy aspects.

results.96-100: Action + Theme

Purpose.name: Purpose
Purpose.description: Because precursor vaults are alien and enigmatic, understanding their ultimate purpose requires investigation and exploration. Use this table to reveal the vault’s original function or role at an appropriate point in your survey. This can come as an outcome of completing an expedition, or when your story naturally leads you to a revelation of the site’s nature.

results.1-3: Capture or control of other beings
results.60-62: Preservation of maps or navigational data
results.70-73: Safekeeping of cultural records or memories
results.81-83: Surveying or monitoring of a location
results.88-90: Worship of a god or being
results.91-95: Action + Theme

Quirks.name: Quirks
Quirks.description: Roll or pick known characteristics of the faction and its members using this table. But keep in mind that even within a small or specialized faction, there are no absolutes. These quirks represent common attitudes, practices, or approaches, but are not universal to every member of that faction. Leave room in your portrayal for diversity and contradictions.

results.4-6: Animal or creature motif used as a faction symbol
results.10-12: Body augmentations are respected and valued
results.13-15: Body ornamentations signify castes or roles
results.25-27: Elite soldiers provide defense or serve as bodyguards
results.40-42: Honors the fallen through unusual death rites
results.43-45: Idolizes a long-dead founder or martyr
results.52-54: Members take a new name when joining the faction
results.58-60: Operates under strict codes or laws
results.61-63: Recognizes others through a distinctive greeting or gesture
results.76-78: Starships share a distinctive and recognizable profile
results.82-84: Symbiotic relationship with a specific type of creature
results.85-87: Trades in a unique currency or commodity
results.88-90: Trains in a demanding physical discipline or martial art
results.91-93: Wields unnatural abilities or strange technologies
results.97-100: Action + Theme

Relationships.name: Relationships
Relationships.description: Factions add scale and narrative opportunities to your setting. But keep it manageable. Don’t overload your campaign with factions. Instead, focus on your interactions and entanglements with members of a few interesting factions. Then, when you have a question about the relationship of one faction to another, use this table. The result is the commonly understood connection between those factions. Further investigations or events may reveal a deeper or alternate truth.

Revealed Aspect.name: Revealed Aspect
Revealed Aspect.description: Roll on this table as you interact with the creature to introduce new features or behaviors. Some results may contradict the established nature of a creature. For example, an amorphous creature that you envisioned as a mass of pure energy would not have typical physical features. If a result doesn’t fit, feel free to ignore, reroll, or adjust. Or envision how this contradiction signals a new understanding or unexpected transformation.

results.93-95: Action + Theme

Rumors.name: Rumors
Rumors.description: Use this table when you are in a position to investigate a faction by uncovering secrets or fishing for gossip.

results.1-3: Caught in the crossfire of feuding factions
results.10-12: Critical resource is in short supply
results.19-21: Digital systems are corrupted or infiltrated
results.25-27: Hit hard by a recent attack or calamity
results.31-33: Holds incriminating information against a leader or faction
results.40-42: Knows the location of a fabled treasure or lost technology
results.43-45: Leaders are haunted by a dark prophecy
results.49-51: Leaders are puppets of another power or faction
results.52-54: Lesser members of the leadership are plotting a coup
results.55-57: New belief or religion is creating a schism among members
results.58-60: Operations are a false front for their true purpose
results.61-63: Overdependence on a failing or vulnerable technology
results.64-66: Plagued by infighting and low morale
results.67-69: Plotting to betray an allied faction
results.70-72: Preparing a major offensive or operation
results.73-75: Pulling the strings of a leader or faction
results.82-84: Sheltering an infamous or dangerous fugitive
results.88-90: Suffering a shortage of key workers or personnel
results.91-93: Uprising or revolt is brewing from within
results.97-100: Action + Theme

results.1-5: Blockade prevents trade with other sectors
results.6-10: Bounty hunters search for an infamous fugitive
results.11-15: Chaotic breaches in spacetime spread like wildfire
results.21-25: Devastating superweapon has fallen into the wrong hands
results.36-40: Newly found resource lures greedy fortune hunters to the sector
results.41-45: Notorious pirate clan preys on starships
results.46-50: Parasitic lifeforms spread like a plague
results.51-55: Precursor sites throughout the sector emit strange signals
results.56-60: Prophecies foretell an imminent awakening of a dreadful power
results.61-65: Raider clan emerges as a dominant threat under a new leader
results.71-75: Rogue AI infiltrates systems throughout the sector
results.76-80: Settlements or factions are on the brink of war
results.86-90: Sickness spreads among ships and settlements
results.96-100: Titanic spaceborne lifeform stalks the spaceways

Starship History.name: Starship History
Starship History.description: Envision how you obtained or earned this ship. You can come up with your own origin, or roll or pick from the table below. If you use a result from the table, take a moment to consider and elaborate on the suggestion.

results.1-8: Acquired in trade for a precious family heirloom
results.26-34: Discovered as a derelict, and patched back together
results.35-42: Earned in exchange for a promise or vow
results.51-58: Granted by an organization or community
results.59-67: Inherited from a relative or mentor
results.68-75: Purchased at a suspiciously cheap price
results.76-84: Stolen from a notorious crime boss or criminal organization
results.85-92: Taken while fleeing an attack or disaster

Starship Quirks.name: Starship Quirks
Starship Quirks.description: Your ship is an important aspect of your character—and a character in its own right. What does it look like? What makes it interesting or uniquely yours? Does it have any particular quirks? If nothing occurs to you now, you can flesh it out in play, or roll once or twice on the table below.

results.1-5: Engine room is scorched with old burn marks
results.6-10: Exterior is marred by rust and grime
results.11-15: Faint, phantom music sometimes echoes through the corridors
results.21-25: Hull is fused with organic growths
results.26-30: Hull rattles and groans in atmospheric flight
results.31-35: Interior spaces are crowded with exposed cables and conduits
results.36-40: Looks defenseless, but exterior panels open to reveal weapons
results.41-45: Navigation logs contain coordinates to locations that do not—or should not—exist
results.46-50: Old bloodstain in the airlock reappears even when painted over
results.51-55: Once a beautiful ship, now scarred by a devastating battle
results.56-60: Patched hull covers a recent catastrophic breach
results.61-65: Placards and control labels are in an uncommon language
results.66-70: Removable plate decks provide access to hidden storage
results.71-75: Segmented landing gear unfold like gangly spider legs
results.76-80: Ship is powered by an ancient precursor device
results.81-85: Someone marked the hull with graffiti during a recent layover
results.86-90: Strange symbols are scrawled on the deck and bulkheads in the main corridor
results.91-95: Things tend to go missing for no logical reason
results.96-100: Timers and clocks are always just a bit off

Stellar Object.name: Stellar Object
Stellar Object.description: Use the Stellar Object oracle to learn more about the primary star at a location. This is mostly to help you visualize your surroundings, but the strange or hazardous nature of some rare stars can incite new adventures.

results.51-60: Young star incubating in a molecular cloud
results.61-70: White dwarf shining with spectral light
results.71-75: Corrupted star radiating with unnatural light
results.76-80: Neutron star surrounded by intense magnetic fields
results.81-85: Two stars in close orbit connected by fiery tendrils of energy
results.86-90: Black hole allows nothing to escape—not even light
results.91-98: Hypergiant star generating turbulent solar winds
results.99-99: Artificial star constructed by a long-dead civilization
results.100-100: Unstable star showing signs of impending supernova

Story Clue.name: Story Clue
Story Clue.description: When you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.13b2d777c6fb719d]{Gather Information} to investigate a mystery, you might uncover clues in the form of messages, rumors, eyewitness reports, data, or physical evidence. You can use this oracle to help reveal what this evidence connects to or implicates. Then, use the outcome of the @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.13b2d777c6fb719d]{Gather Information} roll—strong hit, weak hit, or miss—to guide whether the clue brings clarity or complications.

results.1-3: Подтверждает ранее известный факт или улику
results.4-6: Связано с известным слухом или скандалом
results.7-9: Связано с ранее несвязанной тайной или миссией
results.10-12: Связано с вашими собственными знаниями или интересами
results.13-15: Противоречит ранее известному факту или улики
results.28-30: Связано со скрытой или загадочной фракцией
results.31-33: Связано со скрытым или загадочным человеком
results.34-36: Связано с ключом или способом доступа
results.40-42: Связано с нечеловеческим существом или существом
results.49-51: Связано с человеком или фракцией из вашего прошлого
results.58-60: Связано с организмом или биологическим доказательством
results.61-63: Связано с необычной способностью или силой
results.64-66: Связано с кем-то, кому вы доверяете
results.67-69: Связано с чем-то редким, дорогим или ценным
results.70-72: Ведет в далекое или незнакомое место
results.73-75: Ведет в скрытое или забытое место
results.76-78: Ведет в близкое или знакомое место
results.79-81: Ведет в заметное или центральное место
results.85-87: Предполагает надвигающееся событие или крайний срок
results.91-100: Descriptor + Focus

Story Complication.name: Story Complication
Story Complication.description: This oracle will introduce narrative turns, troubles, and revelations. It can be used as an alternative to the @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.78baa51694fe37c5]{Pay the Price} table when you encounter a negative outcome at a crucial moment. In particular, you might use this table after rolling matched 10s on the challenge dice.

results.5-7: Crucial equipment or device is sabotaged
results.11-14: Enemy reveals unexpected powers, abilities, or influence
results.15-17: Enemy reveals their true agenda or nature
results.18-20: Enemy unexpectedly benefits from your actions
results.24-26: Key location is threatened or made unsafe
results.30-33: Needed item or resource is unavailable
results.34-36: Object of a quest is not what you assumed
results.40-42: Simultaneous problems force a hard choice
results.46-48: Someone important is threatened or endangered
results.49-51: Someone important reveals their problematic secret or history
results.55-57: Technology or device is shown to have unexpected effects
results.66-68: True agenda of a connection or patron is revealed
results.69-72: Trusted information is shown to be false
results.73-76: Two seemingly unrelated problems are shown to be connected
results.85-88: Urgent message distracts you from your quest
results.93-95: You were diverted from the true crisis

Suffix.name: Suffix
Suffix.description: To give a sector or region of space a random name, roll once for the first word and once for the second word. Or just roll once choose a suitable pairing from anywhere in that row.

results.1-40: It’s worse than you thought: Make a suffer move (-2)
results.41-52: Victory is short-lived: A new peril or foe appears
results.53-64: You face collateral damage: Something is lost, damaged, or broken
results.65-76: Others pay the price: Someone else suffers the cost
results.77-88: Others won’t forget: You are marked for vengeance
results.89-100: It gets complicated: The true nature of a foe or objective is revealed

Theme.name: Theme
Theme.description: When you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.bd6278f18bbd6739]{Ask the Oracle} about a goal, situation, or event, roll for an Action and Theme. Together, these provide an interpretative verb/noun prompt.

Theme Type.name: Theme Type
Theme Type.description: Choose a theme that supports what you know of that location’s nature. For a random theme, roll on the table above.

results.1-15: Chaotic (Reality is corrupted or warped in this place.)
results.16-25: Fortified (Enemies defend this place against intruders.)
results.26-35: Haunted (Restless spirits are bound to this place.)
results.36-50: Infested (Foul creatures have overrun this place.)
results.51-60: Inhabited (People have built a community in this place.)
results.61-75: Mechanical (Machines and technology hold sway in this place.)
results.76-90: Ruined (Time, disaster, or war have ravaged this place.)
results.91-100: Sacred (Worshipers glorify strange powers in this place.)

Trouble.name: Trouble
Trouble.description: Check the Settlement Trouble table when it’s appropriate for your character to know or uncover these details. The Settlement Trouble table provides a broad description of the site’s most dramatic current issue.

results.91-100: Action + Theme

results.1-40: Dominion (Governing power)
results.41-70: Guild (Organization of specialists)
results.71-100: Fringe Group (Band of outlaws, outcasts, or rogues)

results.1-10: Immediate catastrophic destruction. All aboard must @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.905205c073b09eac]{Endure Harm} or @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.0cfcd6fbaf6135d0]{Face Death}, as appropriate.
results.11-25: Destruction is imminent and unavoidable. If you do not have the means or intention to get clear, @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.905205c073b09eac]{Endure Harm} or @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.0cfcd6fbaf6135d0]{Face Death} as appropriate.
results.26-40: Destruction is imminent, but can be averted if you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.eece9a67d1961f70]{Repair} your vehicle and raise its integrity above 0. If you fail, see 11-25.
results.41-55: You cannot @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.eece9a67d1961f70]{Repair} this vehicle until you @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.703964b8d02355b8]{Resupply} and obtain a crucial replacement part. If you roll this result again prior to that, see 11-25.
results.56-70: The vehicle is crippled or out of your control. To get it back in action, you must @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.eece9a67d1961f70]{Repair} and raise its integrity above 0.
results.71-85: It's a rough ride. All aboard must make the @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.905205c073b09eac]{Endure Harm}, @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.ff32c523829d6481]{Endure Stress}, or @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.d34cdf2408cd22b6]{Companion Takes a Hit} move, suffering a serious (-2) cost.
results.86-95: You’ve lost fuel, energy, or cargo. @Compendium[foundry-ironsworn.starforgedmoves.0fcfea7696d1de15]{Sacrifice Resources} (-2).
results.96-100: Against all odds, the vehicle holds together.
